item.title: Kick Door To Escape Codes (December 2025)
item.content:encoded:
Use these Roblox Kick Door To Escape monthly redeem codes for December 2025 to get your hands on plenty of free rewards, including Energy Drinks, Energy Bars and much more. 

Kick Door to Escape is a training simulator Roblox experience where you kick doors to reach the end and earn Keys. These Keys are used to unlock new Worlds and buy Prison Items. For new players, earning even a single Key can take a lot of grinding since you won’t have enough Power early on. This is where active codes come in handy. Redeeming them gives you free Food and boosters that double your Cash and Power gains. With these boosts, you can Rebirth more often, grow your Body Size faster, and eventually unlock better areas like the Bank and Mega City Worlds.

Active Kick Door To Escape codes

  • Welcome – 1 Energy Drink (New)
  • New – 1 Energy Bar (New)

Inactive Kick Door To Escape codes

There are no inactive codes for Kick Door To Escape. If an old active code expires, it’ll be added in this part. 

How to redeem Kick Door To Escape codes? 

Follow these steps to activate the codes: 

  1. Launch the game and spawn in the world. 
  2. Press the “Menu” button on the top right corner of the screen. 
  3. Select “Code” to open the code box. 
  4. Enter any active code into the “Enter code” text box. 
  5. Click the “CLAIM” button to redeem the active codes in Kick Door To Escape. 

More About Kick Door To Escape Codes

Foods in Kick Door to Escape are booster variants that will help you train faster, kick doors with more force, and increase your Body Size within a few minutes. As of now, you can only claim Energy Drinks and Energy Bar via the codes. Their usage are as follows: 

  • Energy Drinks – Double your Power for 15 minutes. 
  • Energy Bar – Double your Cash for 15 minutes. 

Generally, it costs Robux to purchase Foods in the game. However, the active codes offer them for free. You can make great use of the free boosters when consumed before kicking down the doors. Energy Bar helps you purchase new gear and hatch the expensive eggs after a couple of runs. Energy Drinks must be consumed before you start breaking doors. This Food increases your chances of reaching the end much faster.  

FAQs on Kick Door To Escape codes

What are the latest active codes? 

“Welcome” and “New” are the latest active codes. 

Can you redeem any pets from the codes?

As of now, none of the active codes can be redeemed for pets. 

How often are new codes released?

You can expect new codes to debut during major milestones and updates.

item.title: Sleeping Dogs Film Adds Nobody 2 Director
item.content:encoded:
The upcoming live-action adaptation of Sleeping Dogs has found its director. As of now, the film is set to star Shang-Chi actor Simu Liu as Wei Shen with a script complete.

Released in 2012, Sleeping Dogs has become quite the cult classic. Following an undercover Hong Kong police officer, players explore an open world with parkour abilities and martial arts. Despite earning positive reviews, low sales led to the series being dead in the water.

However, Hollywood has gotten its hands on it, now reinvigorated by MCU’s Shang-Chi actor Simu Liu, who’ll star as protagonist Wei Shen. A script was revealed to be complete for the project earlier in the year, but it was unknown where it would lead. Now, an up-and-coming action film director is about to take on the long-awaited adaptation.

Timo Tjahjanto to Direct Sleeping Dogs, Starring MCU’s Simu Liu

In a post from Simu Liu on Twitter, it has been confirmed that Timo Tjahjanto will direct Sleeping Dogs. The Indonesian director has done a few films but is just starting to get onto bigger projects. His latest movie, Nobody 2, was a worthy follow-up to the 2021 Bob Odenkirk action flick. He is also attached to direct the sequel to the Jason Statham-led project, The Beekeeper, and a possible Hollywood sequel to Train to Busan.

Interestingly enough, Timo Tjahjanto has been an advocate for Sleeping Dogs to hit the big screens for a while. In response to Simu Liu’s post on the game’s lack of movement anywhere, the director explains its biggest problem was a lack of understanding from executives. When asked about directing the film adaptation, he sent a smiling gif, which has aged incredibly well given today’s news.

The film has yet to acquire a studio or a release date. Still, with a director, writer, script, and Marvel actor at the forefront, it may not be long before one is revealed. Sleeping Dogs has been a work-in-progress in Hollywood, as previous attempts didn’t pan out. Legendary action star Donnie Yen (Rogue One, John Wick: Chapter 4), was attached to play Wei Shen, but it never came around. Hopefully, the film will see the light of day and Sleeping Dogs can get the love it deserves.

What do you think of the director of Sleeping Dogs? Think Timo Tjahjanto is a good pick? Seen any of his films? Do you think Sleeping Dogs will make for a good Hollywood film? Leave a comment below and on the official Insider Gaming Discord!

For more film adaptation news, check out the coverage on Helldivers and Call of Duty. Don’t forget to subscribe to the weekly newsletter!

item.title: Hollow Knight: Silksong Is The Insider Gaming Community’s 2025 Indie Game of the Year
item.content:encoded:
Indie games don’t all fit into the same box anymore. Some are made by small teams taking big creative swings, while others come from well-funded studios operating outside the traditional AAA system. What ties them together isn’t budget, but identity—games built around a clear vision, willing to do things differently, and often unafraid to take risks.

That range was on full display in the Insider Gaming community’s Indie Game of the Year poll, which featured everything from long-awaited sequels to experimental standouts. And when the votes were counted, one title ultimately rose to the top as Hollow Knight: Silksong was voted as the 2025 Indie Game of the Year.

The long-awaited sequel finished first with 21.7% of the vote, just beating out Clair Obscur: Expedition 33’s and Dispatch’s 18.9%. Other games in the running were Ball x Pit (8.5%), Peak (7.5%), Hades 2 (7.5%), Absolum (6.6%), Blue Prince (5.7%), and Schedule I (4.7%).

What makes Silksong’s win stand out is the anticipation for it seemingly paid off upon release, with the game receiving acclaim from players far and wide. But in the end, the results reflect what makes the indie scene so compelling. There’s no single formula for success, only games that connect with players in different ways. This year, the Insider Gaming community made it clear that Hollow Knight: Silksong stood just a bit taller than the rest.

What do you think of the Insider Gaming Community voting Hollow Knight: Silksong as 2025’s Indie Game of the Year? Was there a different game that you preferred? Leave your thoughts down below and join the talk in the Insider Gaming Discord.

For more Insider Gaming Community Awards, check out what game the readers voted as the biggest surprise hit of 2025. And don’t forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Insider Gaming’s Best Sports Game of the Year 2025
item.content:encoded:
Sports games in 2025 were a mixed bag for some fans. But standing out in a crowd of less-than-impressive titles were games that provided both the enjoyable gameplay and depth that fans look for from their sports titles. Insider Gaming has a team that has played as many sports games as possible throughout the year, and it’s been narrowed down to find the best sports game of 2025.

From a multiplayer soccer game to a remaster of a classic, these are games the games that keep you immersed in one way or another to the point you don’t want to put them down. So, without any further delay, let’s find out the top sports game of the year along with those that were nominated.

Best Sports Game Of 2025 Winner — Rematch

Rematch offers one of the freshest takes on soccer in years by embracing fast, chaotic, arcade-style action instead of pure realism. With no fouls, no offsides, and constant play, matches are all about momentum and creativity, perfect for players who want quick, high-energy sessions rather than slow build-up play.

Its multi-position gameplay that relies more on positioning and teamwork than other soccer games give it the feel of a competitive action game wrapped in a sports shell. Rematch earns its spot as the best sports game for 2025 because it brings something genuinely different to the genre: a fun, accessible football experience that emphasizes excitement over simulation.

Available On: PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S

Best Sports Game of 2025 Nominations

MLB The Show 25

MLB The Show 25 continues to be the gold standard for sports simulations, offering one of the most complete and polished experiences of the year. Enhanced presentation updates like improved lighting, better stadium detail, and more fluid animations make every pitch, hit, and defensive play feel more authentic. The series’ signature modes—Franchise, Road to the Show, Diamond Dynasty—all return with a mix of subtle and major refinements that deepen long-term engagement without overwhelming new players. It earns a place on this list because it once again delivers the most realistic and consistently enjoyable baseball gameplay available anywhere in 2025.

Available On: PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S

Maximum Football

Maximum Football makes a major statement in 2025 with a fully rebuilt experience powered by Unreal Engine 5 and a free-to-play model that opens the door for a massive audience. Its Dynasty Mode lets players recruit, develop talent, and build a program from the ground up. To add to it, a Franchise Mode allows you to watch your players go from College to the Pro’s in one continued universe with a true sandbox feel. Maximum Football stands out because it’s one of the few football titles this year willing to challenge the long-established giants in the genre. Its mix of accessibility, customization, and modern presentation makes it one of the year’s most promising and refreshing sports games.

Available On: PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S

Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 3 + 4

Tony Hawk’s Pro Skater 3 + 4 brings two of the most iconic extreme-sports games ever made into the modern era with a full remake that feels both nostalgic and brand new. The updated visuals, smoother mechanics, and variety of multiplayer modes breathe new life into fan-favorite levels, while the soundtrack blends returning classics with new additions to keep the energy high. Whether you’re chasing high scores, exploring levels, or skating online with friends, the collection captures the timeless “one more run” appeal the series built its legacy on. It earns a place among 2025’s best because it’s a masterclass in how to modernize a classic without losing what made it special.

Available On: PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, Nintendo Switch 2

PGA Tour 2K25

PGA Tour 2K25 refines the golf sim formula with its new EvoSwing system, offering more realistic shot shaping and better feedback for both newcomers and experienced players. The upgraded MyCareer mode adds deeper progression through skill trees, equipment upgrades, and expanded customization options, giving players more ownership over their golfer than ever before. Online societies, seasonal content, and a wide range of competitive formats ensure the game has long legs throughout the year. It deserves a spot on the list because it delivers the most complete and adaptable golf experience of 2025, appealing equally to casual players and true sim enthusiasts.

Available On: PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S

What sports games did you enjoy in 2025? Leave your thoughts down below, and join the discussion in the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

NOTE: Insider Gaming may earn affiliate commission if you purchase items through links on Insider Gaming. Read more about affiliate commission here.

item.title: 7 Biggest ARC Raiders Features We Want in 2026
item.content:encoded:
ARC Raiders is one of the biggest games of 2025 by far, boasting a massive player base, a stunning delivery, and the promise of plenty more content to come. It’s an electrifying extraction adventure that millions of people have bought into, and it’s challenging the likes of Escape from Tarkov with ease.

However, regardless of how good ARC Raiders is, there are still plenty of features players want to see added in 2026. What follows below are the 7 features that we want to see added to ARC Raiders in 2026.

7 ARC Raiders Changes We Want to See

PvE Servers or Modes

Fighting other players in ARC Raiders is a core part of the central gameplay experience, but it would be nice if there were also a PvE-exclusive mode or server selection that users could jump into to have an ‘easier ride’. For some, PvP is too punishing and stressful, and it would be great if Embark Studios could accommodate those players with their own ‘ecosystem’.

If Escape from Tarkov can muster up a PvE mode, then ARC Raiders should be able to do it too.

Better Outfit Customization

ARC Raiders has a stunning array of outfits, but they’re just that, outfits. It would be brilliant if players could cherry-pick parts of outfits to equip on their character, rather than throwing on something whole and mostly static. What if I love the helmet on one outfit but think it would go better with a jacket on another outfit?

It would likely be hard to implement as the outfits are intricately designed one by one, but some kind of transmog feature in ARC Raiders would be great.

New Maps

This is an obvious one, but we want to see more maps in ARC Raiders in 2026. The game has a neat assortment of maps already, but there’s a world of potential out there. It’s a known fact that Embark Studios plans to add plenty more, but it’s not just about getting new maps; it’s about getting quality maps that are a wonder to explore.

The first new map, released in November 2025, was Stella Montis, and it proved to be a die-hard PvP map with tight quarters and narrow sightlines.

Item Insurance

In some extraction games, item insurance is a core mechanic that allows you to recoup some losses when you’re killed in action. In ARC Raiders, that’s not a feature. If you die in the field, your equipment will be lost forever. The only difference to that rule is when you’re killed by a cheater, Embark Studios will refund your equipment.

If they can do it for cheaters, then surely they can implement a mechanic that allows users to insure their items, so if they die in a raid, they get their loadout back after a few hours.

Less Punishing Stamina Mechanics

The stamina mechanics in ARC Raiders are a bane for many players. They’re too strict in many ways, and when your stamina bar empties while you’re running away from an engagement, you’ll find that you almost stop dead on the spot, unable to move. In a desperate situation, it’s far too unrealistic, and it leaves players feeling frustrated quite often.

Even when you’ve maximized your stamina-focused skill points, it still feels as though your stamina bar empties too quickly. Better stamina mechanics would make for a new feature in ARC Raiders in 2026.

Expedition Adjustments

The Expedition Project is the optional wipe mechanic in ARC Raiders, and it allows players to donate stacks of resources to escape Speranza into the great beyond. Once they’ve done that, they’ll be left with a new and fresh character, ready to go again. However, the requirements for completing an Expedition Project are pretty insane.

To get the maximum rewards possible from completing an Extraction Project, you need to have a stash value (coins included) of five million. It feels inaccessible for the more casual gamers who will be left out in the cold when they realize they won’t gain much from their Expedition Project.

More Achievements

ARC Raiders has a fine assortment of achievements and trophies, but they’re far too easy to unlock just by exploring the game and ticking a few boxes. As the game is a live-service title that’s set to evolve over a number of years, it would be good to see more achievements surface with the successive updates that hit the game.

This keeps completionists occupied and able to enjoy the game more. If you play ARC Raiders for around 50 hours and see all there is to see, it’s a fair chance you’ll have almost unlocked all the achievements.

What would you like to see added to ARC Raiders in the next year or so? Let us know on the Insider Gaming Discord server.
